# [TYPE]: Brief description (50 chars)
# |<---- Use 50 characters max in this line ----->|

# Detailed explanation of changes (72 chars per line)
# |<---- Try to limit each line to 72 characters ------------------->|
# 
# Explain the problem this commit is solving. Focus on why you
# are making this change as opposed to how. Are there side effects
# or other unexpected consequences of this change?

# --- COMMIT END ---
# TYPE can be:
#    feat     (new feature)
#    fix      (bug fix)
#    refactor (code restructuring, no functionality change)
#    style    (formatting, missing semicolons, etc; no code change)
#    docs     (changes to documentation)
#    test     (adding or refactoring tests; no production code change)
#    chore    (updating build tasks, package configs, etc; no production code change)
# --------------------
# Remember to:
#    - Separate subject from body with a blank line
#    - Capitalize the subject line
#    - Do not end the subject line with a period
#    - Use the imperative mood in the subject line (e.g., "Add" not "Added")
#    - Wrap the body at 72 characters
#    - Use the body to explain what and why vs. how
# --------------------
